line.en: 'La la laaa'
'What are you writing?'
'A flight log.'
'A flight log...? Even though you haven't been\nflying?'
'Yeah. This is much cooler than writing a daily\njournal of our activities.'
'...I suppose so.'
'Hey! Don't look!'
'Why not? It's our daily activities journal,\nisn't it?'
'Flight log!'
'...You're saying I'm dumb aren't you...'
'Heh, maaaybe.'
'Grrr.'
'By the way, Amane...'
'What is it?'
'That guy who helped out the other day...From the\nother class... Do you remember?'
'Of course I do. I may be dumb but I'm not dumb\nenough that I can't remember something that\nhappened three days ago.'
'Oh, He's in the next class over, isn't he...'
'His name is Tatsuya Igarashi, but yeah...'
'Do you think he might join our club?'
'Hm? Why?'
'B, because, well he's good with his hands and\nhe's going to inherit a factory and all. He's\nbeen doing that stuff since he was little.'
'Hmm...but between the two of us, I don't think\nthere are any problems with the manufacturing\nwork.'
'...Yes there are.'
'The parts you made were all wonky and we\ncouldn't use them.'
'That's strange... I made them right...'
'When it comes to matters about yourself... you\ndon't know anything, huh?'
'If he joined I think it would add a lot to our\npotential.'
'Hmm, you might be right about that...'
'What's wrong? You look a little down all of a\nsudden.'
'...When you talk about boys you feel a little\ndistant is all.'
'You're not... jealous, are you?'
'Jealous? Is that what you call this feeling?'
'Hee hee. I'm so happy you're my BFF.'
'But since I was born a girl, at least once in my\nlife I want to make a big, beautiful flower\nbloom.'
'Is it that love makes all the difference in\nsomeone's life?'
'Hmm.'
'Ah! You're looking gloomy again... you're so\ncute Amane!'
'I don't know, but for some reason I don't see it\nthat way. That's why I don't want that boy to\njoin.'
'Wait, wait! Time out! You're my number one best\nfriend. That's probably never going to change.'
'Pinky swear.'
I didn't really understand what Isuka was talking\nabout at that time.
I didn't even understand my own feelings.
I was just confused because the Isuka who loved\nsomeone seemed different to the Isuka I'd always\nknown.
'Club leader Kotori... Er, Club Leader-dono!'
'Yes! Hey, that has a nice ring to it. Sounds a\nlittle bossy though...'
'Yeah, yeah. Hurry up.'
'Yeah, let's go in.'
'This introduction is so long...'
'Wait, wait! Don't rush me! Having taken office\nas the new club leader of the new Soaring Club\nthis is my first official duty.'
'(Gulp) ...Shall we?'
When she finished her first, vitally important\nand ceremonious job of opening the shutter, we\nstepped inside the garage together.
'This is...'
'Huhhh...'
It was just as we had left it one year ago.
We had left the desk messy.
The shelves were strewn with loose books and\ndocuments.
And the floor was covered with abandoned tools.
Some of us had left our own things lying around\ntoo.
And then there was the glider...
Standing in the doorway, for a short time we\ntraveled back in time to that summer one year ago\nand gazed at the scene.
'We've finally come back, huh...'
It was a long year.
Time and time again I'd thought we would never\nget this place back.
But finally, here we are...
'We did it, Kotori.'
Ageha spoke and patted Kotori on the head.
'We did it.'
I pat her on the shoulder too.
'Yeah...we did it.'
Kotori's voice is choked with tears.
'Again, with the crying...'
'Is there something wrong with your tear ducts\nlately?'
'What, there's nothing wrong with a person crying\nwhen they feel something like this.'
'Yeahhhh. Right. Here's your hankerchief.'
'*sniff* 'Thanks, Asa.'
With the hankerchief she borrowed from Asa,\nKotori wiped her tears and then looked over the\ngarage once again.
'We haven't just come back here...'
'...We also have Amane with us again!'
Kotori speaks proudly and from her pupil a tear\ndrops and then bursts.
And then the real deal came up behind us.
'What's wrong? Aren't you going to go in?'
She passed us and entered, going to the back of\nthe garage.
'Ah, wai... Amane! Now is a good time!'
'Hm?'
Amane set a suitcase on the desk with a loud\nthud.
At that instant...
Ahhh!
Dust was sent flying!
'Gah!' *cough, cough*'
'*cough, cough* 'What's all this?'
'O... Oh no, take shelter!'
'*cough, cough* 'Open the window! We need\nventilation!'
'Y, yeah!'
Amidst the flying dust, Amane stands like it is\nno problem at all.
'Amane, come here! If you stay there you'll get\nsick!'
'Yeah, your nose will get all itchy.'
'And it stinks...like the gym storage room.'
'...Looks like we're cleaning first.'
'I'll go get things to clean with...'

At once my fleeting impressions were cast away
and I was brought back to reality, back to the
dirt and dust that had accumulated over a whole
year.
'Whew, here we are.'
Ageha squeezed the rag she held and wiped the\nsweat from her forehead with her arm.
'Hahhh...it's so big that it will be hard to\nclean.'
'Let's worry about the detailed cleaning next\ntime. If we can get it back to normal, that would\nbe good enough for now.'
'Even if we do it that way, what is this mountain\nof junk?'
I wonder what in the world all this misplaced\nstuff left behind by the previous owners of the\ngarage is.
There are dart gun replicas, models, toy swords\nand spears, and chain mail for some reason.

There are also manga magazines from more than ten
years ago, banners and signs probably used in
school festivals, fancy costumes and an engine
that can't possibly belong to a glider.
'Get it all together and throw it away. That's\nokay right, Amane?'
'You don't have to ask me. This is your place\nnow.'
'Okay, we're gonna chuck it!'
'Let's separate it later.'
'Are we done clearing things out for now?'
We all look at each other.
'No, not yet. We still have some finishing\ntouches.'
Kotori said that and went over to the desk in the\nback.
That was Amane's favorite desk until last summer.
She was pretty much always in front of either the\ndrafting board or this desk.
Kotori reached the desk and there was a rustling\nsound as she pulled something from a bag.
She puts it on the desk.
'A picture frame?'
'Yup.'
The picture in the frame was the one of the\nMorning Glory.
Formerly, that had been the picture's rightful\nplace.
Kotori put another picture frame next to it.
It was a picture of everyone gathered together\nafter the last flight.
We look at those two pictures and are flooded\nwith emotions.
'Next time, we will fly.'
'Yeah.'
'Yep.'
'...I'm so jealous of your seniors.'
Asa looks enviously at the photos she isn't in.
'You two will be in the next pictures.'
'Yeah, that's right.'
'Okay! Ehehehe!'
'Hee hee... Not bad.'
We should not be looking to the past.
'It's obvious but, it's still broken huh...'
In the corner of the garage was the disassembled\nglider.
The wings were damaged.

When the glider got caught in a strong downward
current during last year's final flight, the nose
got turned upward which overloaded the craft and
caused some damage.
'We have to fix this too...'
'Sorry for leaving it that way all year.'
Amane watched us from a short distance as we\ntalked and looked over the glider.
She seemed curiously jealous.
'Hey, everyone...'
'Hm? What's up, Amane?'
'Oh, um...'
'...Aren't you going to ask? Why I've decided to\nbe your supervisor.'
Kotori looked at Ageha uneasily.
Ageha shook her head and looked at me.
I returned the look to Kotori as if to say 'I\nleave it up to you.
Asa and Yoru stared in puzzlement at the three\nseniors around them who had become dumb struck.
'Yeahhhh... yeah, we're good.'
After the first 'yeah,' Kotori took her sweet\ntime figuring out what to say.
Amane looks surprised.
'Why don't you want to know?'
'To be honest, I'm super curious and I want to\nask...'
'But if I start digging for answers I might hit a\nland mine!'
Hearing 'land mine,' Amane doesn't look so well.
Is Kotori right? Is there something buried in\nthat question?
'At that time how could you say something so\nhorrible! What the hell were you thinking!'
'Are things I feel like saying to you to some\ndegree...but what's important is...'
'...Is that you've come back.'
'That you've come back to this garage. That\nyou've come to be with us.'
'That you've come to aim for the Morning Glory\nonce again with us.'
'Because that is enough.'
'...Am I aiming for the Morning Glory?'
Amane muttered the words as if learning this for\nthe first time.
'What?! You're not?!'
'Oh, uh...well, if you all are then I... I am\ntoo.'
'Damn right you are! Good lord, what am I asking\nyou for?'
Kotori huffs angrily.
'...So I guess I shouldn't ask why then?'
She glances at us, apparently without confidence.
'If you want to, go ahead...'
She flinches, urged on by Ageha.
'...I don't really want to say.'
'It's just that... I thought I'd like to fly the\nglider again with everyone... because...'
Amane tries really hard to pull all these loose\nthoughts together and put them into words.
Hearing that, we all look at each other again.
'That's all we need to hear. The rest you can say\nwhen you're ready. Right, everyone?'
Ageha and I nod.
'...Thank you everyone. I'll do my best as your\nsupervisor.'
'Please.'
Kotori patted Amane on the arm encouragingly.
Seeing that, Ageha whispered, 'She's as great as\never, huh.
We headed home.
Everyone felt warm and fuzzy inside.
Our garage and glider had come back to us.
And starting tomorrow, we can do actual Soaring\nClub activities!
So we walked and talked excitedly about the\ndreams that had come true.
'Ha ha ha... Is that right?'
Amane joined us and is laughing happily.
'Hey, Aoi.'
For some reason Kotori called to me.
I had been watching Amane and unnerved, I switch\nmy gaze to Kotori in a hurry.
'What?'
'It's great isn't it.'
'What is?'
'That she came back.'
Saying that, she turns toward Amane.
'...Yeah.'
I nodded earnestly.
'You ought to ask her out.'
'Don't be stupid. I did and I was rejected. Last\nyear.'
Kotori looks bored when I answer.
'Really though, you two should go out... if you\nwere dating Amane, I think I could count on you\nto take care of her.'
She mutters.
Why are you acting like our senior's guardian?
'She's done a lot to come back to us. I don't\nwant to put all that out there and create an\nawkward atmosphere.'
'Besides... getting that across was enough.'
'Huh.'
Kotori makes a face that says 'I understand, but\nI don't really get it.
I glance at Amane walking just a ways off from\nme.
'He he he he, I'm so excited.'
She laughs, talking with Ageha about something.
Just being in the same place as Amane...
Is enough for me.
'(Wanting any more than that is just excessive)'
I thought, feeling that she was close to me.
The few days following the resurrection of our\nclub felt both emotional and not emotional at the\nsame time.
We were about to push ahead with the plans to\nimprove the craft.
But regrettably we are students.
And students have tests.
We were at the end of the first semester, which\nmeant tests before summer vacation ...final\nexams.
Having just been officially recognized for club\nactivities, we had to abide the rule that forbids\nclub activities during the exam period.
After school on the first day of exams I went to\nthe garage.
'Huh? Amane??'
When I entered the garage I found Amane camped\nout at the desk.
It brought back a wave of nostalgia.
'Hey Aoi. You're later than I expected. Where is\neveryone?'
'...Our exams started today, so there aren't any\nclub activities. Didn't I say so?'
'Hm? Humm... you might have...'
She says it like either way is fine with her and\ngoes back to using the computer on the desk.
'What are you doing?'
'I got us a new computer. Before we get to work\non the aircraft there was something I wanted to\ndo.'
Amane is working away diligently with the mouse\nand keyboard.
It seems like she is setting up the new computer.
'Huh.'
'What's up?'
'Nothing, i...it's just that I'm no good with\ncomputers. I was just thinking how amazing it was\nto watch you work like this.'
If I had to say it, I'd call myself an analog\nperson.
'Ah that's what you mean...'
'...That kind of reminds me, you draft your\ndiagrams by hand, right?'
'Hm? Yeah...' she says, turning her eyes to the\ndrafting board in the back of the garage.
'That drafting board was here from before.'
'I used it because it was neat. Good tools are\nthose that are loved and used even past their\nera.'
Surprised, I was thinking about her attachment to\ntools when I remembered that her real job was\nthat of an inventor.
Or in other words, she creates tools.
'And besides, it costs a lot of money to get a\nbig printer for diagrams.'
It's way out of the scope of the club's budget.
But then again so is building a homemade glider.
'Aoi, what did you come here for?'
'I forgot something... oh, here it is.'
I put my cell phone down and forgot it here\nyesterday...
I don't really use it much, so I often put it\ndown and forget about it.
'While I'm at it, I'm kinda thinking about\nstudying here for tomorrow's test and then\nheading home.'
'I see. In that case, go for it.'
she says, and turns to the computer screen.
'...If I'm not in the way at all.'
'There's no reason you would be.'
She says it so matter-of-factly that it makes me\nhappy somehow.
'All right. Yeah just a little bit.'
'...Kotori and them aren't with you?'
'They all met at the Flying Fish Manor to study.'
Until now I'd been neglecting my exam studies so\nI could see to the revival of the Soaring Club.
Just about now everyone is meeting up to study.
'Why aren't you going to study with them?'
'...They're too noisy to study with.'
It's like when girls get together they just can't\nshut up. I can't focus on my studies.
'Besides...'
'Hm?'
'Uh, nevermind.'
If I were to say I didn't consider running into\nher if I came here,
it would be a lie.
But she knew we all have tests so I didn't think\nshe'd actually be here.
'Right. Well I'll try to be quiet too.'
After that she didn't make a sound aside from the\nclicks and clacks from her mouse and keyboard.
Getting the hint she was giving me, I focused on\npreparing for tomorrow's test.
'You got it? Here is how that last problem works\nwhen put to practical use.'
'Huh. I gotcha. That's really easy to\nunderstand.'
'That's what I told you earlier and you didn't\nget it at all...'
'Yeah, I know but it's hard.'
'Yoru, what that's you are reading? It looks\ncrazy hard! Doesn't have anything to do with the\ntest either, does it?'
'I already finished studying for my tests, so...'
'Man, I didn't realize twins could be so\ndifferent.'
'Don't say that!'
'Eh, can't be helped. There are lots of different\npeople. They have all got their strengths and\nweaknesses.'
'What am I good at?'
'You're adorable. More so than your sister.'
'Yeah, righteously cute!'
'Sorry I'm not cute enough for you.'
'That's not what I meant! You're cute too!\nThere's no doubt about that!'
'Oh by the way, I was wondering about this\nbefore, but...'
'Does Aoi...like Amane?'
'It does look that way, doesn't it.'
'...He steals glances at her and just kinda looks\nhappy when he's around her.'
'Seems like he tries to hide it though.'
'(Aoi! It's obvious! It's even obvious that\nyou're trying to hide it!)'
'Hey Kotori, what do you think?'
'Whaaat?! I, um... I guess, yeah I don't know!'
'I wonder if Amane has a boyfriend.'
'Yeah me too.'
'Maybe she does...'
'At least, she didn't have one last year.'
'She's really beautiful and has good style too. I\ndon't get why more guys don't try to get together\nwith her.'
'Oh yeah? I wonder...'
'Why, are you disappointed?'
'Yeah, of course. In that case, Aoi might get\nrejected.'
'(...He kinda already did a long time ago...)'
'...What are you going on about over there?'
'Nothing...'
'Ooh... I'm too curious to concentrate on\nstudying.'
'...You started it, didn't you?'
'But, I can't stop thinking about it!'
'All right! Let's find out for sure!'
'Hello!'
'Welcome back, Aoi.'
'Hi, Asa.'
'Excuuuuuse me.'
Amane enters from behind me.
'Oh, Amane!'
'I invited her over for dinner.'
Asa didn't listen to a word I said and ran over\nto the dining hall as soon as she saw Amane.
'What was that?'
Going into the dining hall with Amane, it is like\nwe are caught in a crossfire of glances.
'Wha...What's going on?'
It is a strange sign that Amane is a little\nscared.
'...We were just at the garage together so I\ninvited her over for dinner. Is that a problem?'
'(He said they were together.)'
'(I bet that means what I think it does!)'
'(...Nice, Aoi.)'
'...On second thought maybe I'll go home.'
'Wait, no! No, Amane, don't go home!'
'Damnit guys! They came all the way over here so\nwelcome them! If you have to, dance like fish to\nmake them feel welcome!'
'Y, yeah. Aoi mustered the nerve to bring her\nhere!'
'I'll be supportive.'
'I'll just watch from a distance.'
What the hell. Everyone is acting really\nstrangely.
'...You guys are kinda scaring me.'
'Phewww, I'm so full.'
She looks satisfied as she rubs her full belly.
'...I feel like I should apologize or something.'
During dinner their strange behavior didn't get\nany better.
They watched Amane and I from the corners of\ntheir eyes the whole time.
'(What is going on...)'

But once we started eating Amane paid it no mind
and for the first time in a long while she showed
me the way she eats that makes me forget how
beautiful she is.
'Well anyway, I'll see you later...'
'Wait, wait! Amane, stoooooooop!'
With fierce momentum, Kotori came flying from the\nother end of the hallway in her wheelchair.
'Hm?'
'Wait just a second, I need to talk to you!'
As if secretly supporting Kotori, the other girls\nare poking their heads out from around the corner\nof the hallway, watching the course of events.
'That's okay, I suppose...'
'Oh, oh um okay...let's go to Asa's room! Asa and\nYoru. That's okay, right?'
The twins nod in unison.
However that is on the second floor.
'Alright, everyone help carry Kotori.'
Everyone takes hold of the wheelchair and lifts\nit up when Ageha says this.
'What, you're going to carry it all the way to\nthe second floor? Why don't you just talk on the\nfirst floor?'
'Because we can't.'
'Ugh... this is heavy.'
'Kotori, maybe you should think about dieting...'
'No way! It's just the chair that's heavy!'
'...Shall I help?'
'Nope.'
I was turned down unambiguously.
'No boys allowed. You're prohibited from\nfollowing us too.'
'...What the hell is that?'
'What did you need to talk about?'
'*cough* 'Umm, you want a snack?'
'Here, have a Prech.'
'We have chocolate.'
'I'll get some drinks.'
'...my bus is going to come pretty soon.'
'(Hey, Kotori.)'
'(Kotori.)'
'Uh, um Amane'
'...Is there anyone that you, that you like?'
'Someone I like? Ah, yeah there's someone.'
'No way!'
'Who? Who?!'
'Umm...everyone here!'
'That's not what we meant!'
'It's not?'
'We're really happy, but that's not the kind of\n'like' we were talking about.'
'Here are the drinks.'
'Ah, I'll pour them.'
'What we're trying to say is...'
'Do you have a boyfriend?'
'Ah, you said it!'
'Blurted it out, more like.'
'A boyfriend?'
'Yes, I do.'
'Whhhhaaaaaaat?!?!'
'Reaalllly?!'
'Wh, Who?! Who's dating Amane without my\npermission?!'
'I thought so! Did you meet at work?'
'...It's Aoi.'
'Huh?'
'Er, huh? What do you mean?'
'Oh! Earlier today, before we came here did you\ntwo make it official?'
'Today? No, not today.'
'So when, then?'
'Um...since last year.'
'Nooooo waaaaay!!'
'Wait, what? Did you two hide it from us this\nwhole time?'
'Oh, an 'adult' relationship...' *blushes bright\nred*'
'But it really didn't seem tha way. So, what? Was\nAoi acting?'
'No way! That can't be! I mean... Aoi...'
'(He said he got rejected.)'
'Wh...what do you mean? Could you tell us all\nabout it? Step-by-step.'
'Uh, sure.'
'On the last day of summer vacation last year,\nAoi told me...y'know, that he likes me.'
'So I answered like this, I said 'Yeah, I got\nit.''
'Huh...and then?'
'What? And then nothing. That's it.'
'...After that, you didn't meet for a whole year?\nOr have you been contacting each other secretly?'
'Nope. The other day was the first time we'd met\nin a while.'
'...This story is too convoluted for me to follow\nit.'
'When you put it that way... you're not even\nreally dating.'
'Yeah, that's about right.'
'...Yeah and Aoi thinks he got turned down.'
'Huh?'
'Yup.'
'Why? He said he likes me and I accepted.'
'Well, yeah but...'
'...So if I say yes to him liking me, that\ndoesn't establish a relationship?'
'But after that you havent been meeting, so you\ncan't really call it a relationship.'
'Hmm. Then what does it take to establish that\ntwo people are dating?'
'Meet often, call each other, something like\nthat, right?'
'...What? Then we're dating. Don't scare me like\nthat.'
'No, no, no. You've got it all wrong! It's not\nabout running into each other at school.'
'If that were the case then everyone in the class\nwould be dating.'
'Ugh... this is complicated. Well, what should I\ndo?'
'Don't you already know? That much, at least.'
'No, I don't. That's why I'm asking...'
'How can we explain this...'
'Well, Amane. At the very least, Aoi doesn't\nthink you're together.'
'...R, really?'
'No, no, that's not it. It's not that he doesn't\nlike you.'
'...I'm getting all confused. Everyone is so wise\nand experienced.'
'...Does someone have experience?'
'...I wonder what everyone is talking about on\nthe second floor.'
Judging by their voices and the echoes of\nKotori's screeching coming down the stairs it\nsounds fun and exciting.
'...Lucky. I wish I were up there talking with\nAmane too.'
'Quack.'
Hat, standing at my feet, called out as if he is\nworried about me.
'When I say I'm the girls' dorm mother, they all\nget a little envious...'
'Being the only guy in a group of girls can be\nreally lonely sometimes, Hat.'
'Quack, quack.'
Hat and I just focused on our studies together at\nthe dining hall table.
'Which is why I have called a special guest!'
'What happened?'
'Um, hey Amane, uhm...' *mutter mutter*'
'Hmm, hmm. I see.'
'So, yeah. Go ahead and explain!'
'Ah, Amane.'
'What is it?'
'This is reeeaaallly hard to say, but...'
'You two aren't dating.'
'Wh, what?!'
'Frankly, that may be how you feel on the inside,\nbut objectively, going by the facts it's more\nlike this:'

'Aoi put himself out there and confessed his love
for you. Then even though you accepted it, since
you stopped coming to school you had turned him
down.'
'He still fosters those feelings for you\nsecretly, but lives with it bravely, keeping an\neye on you from a distance.'
'Yep, yep. That's Kana for you. Very easy to\nunderstand.'
'So that was it...'
'What do I do? This whole time I thought I had a\nboyfriend and even told my colleagues at the lab\nabout it...'
'I've even had suitors a number of times but I\nturned them down because I thought I was going\nout with Aoi.'
'That's a good thing!'
'An unprecedented, but fine play!'
'But having bragged like that about your\nimaginary boyfriend, it'd be embarrassing if word\ngot out.'
'Imaginary boyfriend...'
'Okay, so... what are the conditions for dating?'
'Calling each other, emailing and dating... stuff\nlike that, but there is a simpler definition than\nthat.'
'Which is...?'
'That you both recognize that you're going out.'
'Ohhh...'
'I see. It was only Amane that thought that way.'
'...It's been a disaster for Aoi too. For a whole\nyear his love has gone unrequited.'
'So what should I do? Won't you tell me?'
'First you have to tell me. Do you like Aoi?'
'Do you?'
'Yes, I do.'
'As a boy, you mean?'
'Y, yes...probably.'
'Why aren't you confident about that!?'
'Ah, ahh... because I don't have any experience\nand I don't really understand...'
'But even still, you want to date him.'
'*nodding*'
'In that case... tell that to Aoi clearly and see\nhow he responds.'
'But she doesn't know what dating is like. I'm\nreally worried about her.'
'Once again an unexpected play from left field!'
'Uhh...I'm worried too.'
'If you search on the net you should find some\nlectures on love. Why not study that way?'
'I didn't know there was anything like that! I'll\ncheck it out as soon as possible!'
'Ughh... heavyyy...'
'You ate those snacks and gained some weight\nsince the last time...'
'Huhh, my arms are shaking...!'
'Don't drop me! My life is in your hands!\nLiterally!'
'Are you done talking?'
When I finished cleaning up in the hallway,\nKotori and the others came down from the second\nfloor.
'Ah, Aoi. Help us!'
'...You said you didn't need my help earlier. So\nselfish.'
Complaining along the way, I go to help them.
Coming down the stairs is more exhausting, not to\nmention dangerous, than going up.
'There you go.'
'Wheww, thanks.'
'Thank you, Aoi.'
'What were you all talking about?'
When I ask, they all glance at each other\nuncomfortably.
'Oh, nothing to do with you.'
'Yeah it had nothing to do with you.'
It hurts that they tried to deceive me.
Thinking that, I saw Amane come down from the\nsecond floor.
Seeing her pale face and trembling legs, I\nwondered if she had some kind of a shock.
Watching her worriedly, our eyes met when she was\nhalf-way down the stairs.
At that moment, Amane's pale face turned bright\nred.
'Amane, what's wrong?'
'Oh, um. Uhh, it... it's... umm.'
For some reason, when she looks at me she seems\nnervous.
'(Amane, here is your chance!)'
'(Good luck!)'
'Uh, uhm, Aoi...'
'Yes.'
